page.title: 03Farming, Bleakholt Sanctuary
page.content: Some of the farms are no longer used for traditional farming but have developed more specialised functions. {Bleakholt Farm}is now an animal sanctuary and{ Fecit Farm}is now concerned with the breeding of pedigree dogs, namely Great Danes. Bleakholt covers about 34 acres and has been in operation for 18 years, whilst Fecit Farm is small by comparision occuping 5 _ 6 acres. Bleakholt Animal Sanctuary, situated just outside Turn Village, does not provide boarding kennel facilities for the many dogs, nor is it a resting place for any of the animals whose owners may go on holiday. It is only a sanctuary for animals which have been abandoned, mistreated or lost. The Sanctuary will acccept any animal as long as it can be adequately cared for.
